title: A Sisterhood of Co - Authors Will Spread Girl Power at the 2024 Los Angeles Times Festival of Books
body_text:
A Sisterhood of Co-Authors Will Spread Girl Power at the 2024 Los Angeles Times Festival of Books
Seven women empower readers with seven stories that are geared towards healing and transformation.
This was such a great, inspiring read! All stories showed perseverance and strength from these ladies! I bought another one to gift to a special lady I know. Dominique Colon, Amazon Review
Self-publishing and book marketing company ReadersMagnet will display Becoming Visible: Emerging to Greater Heights, Volume 1 by Nurse Candyce Pirtle-Smalls and her sisterhood of co-authors at the 2024 Los Angeles Times Festival of Books. The book festival will take place at the University of Southern California, Los Angeles, on April 20-21, 2024.
The L.A. Times Festival of Books is an annual public festival celebrating community, literature, culture, and arts. Considered the largest book festival in the U.S., the event has drawn around 150,000 visitors annually. Visitors include authors, book lovers, exhibitors, celebrities, artists, and musicians. Aside from book exhibits, the Los Angeles Times Festival of Books hosts events that include performances and storytelling for children, author signings, and panel discussions.
Becoming Visible is a self-help book written by seven extraordinary women who aim to empower and inspire their readers through their stories of triumph from domestic abuse. This Butterfly Principle Anthology helps its readers gain strength and direction towards healing and transformation.
Will encourage women to be refined through their pain and suffering, to achieve, and to emerge rejuvenated. This is their time and season to emerge as Esthers to bring restorative, healthy healing to women of every tribe, tongue, and generation. Forward by Apostle Jacqueline Quillens
In this volume, Nurse Candyce Pirtle-Smalls is joined by six other courageous women with the power to enlighten readers: Charleszetta Baldwin (aka Charlie on the Spot), Ericka Parker, Tracey Frison, Shardae Seals Jones, Tamela Gospel, and Teisha Levi LMFT. These women wrote through their pain. They stood still and fought their challenges as they thrived through the storm that once clouded their lives. These women work together to educate, inspire, and guide their readers through transformative healing.
Get a copy of Becoming Visible: Emerging to Greater Heights, Volume 1 by Nurse Candyce Pirtle-Smalls and her sisterhood of co-authors on Amazon.
Authors Biography:
Becoming Visible: Emerging to Greater Heights, Volume 1, 7 Extraordinary Women Spread their Wings with the Courage to Fly Higher. Author Nurse Candyce Pirtle-Smalls known for Best Seller Mindful Meal Prep: Clean, Delicious, Recipes for Weight Loss is back with 6 Co- Authors: Ericka Parker, Tracey Frison, Charleszetta Baldwin aka Charlie on the Spot, Shardae Seal Jones, Teisha Levi L.M.F.T., and Tamela Gospel.
Candyce Pirtle Smalls LVN a child of God a dedicated Nurse, Executive Leader, Educator, Motivational and International Speaker. x3 best seller Author, scene on Good Day Sacramento, 4 KRON news. Bay Area native, teen mom to nurse entrepreneur with a passion for education and advocating for mental health, DV, healthcare equity and aspiring nurse empowerment. Founder F.I.T. Butterfly Innovation Inc. nonprofit organization.
Teisha Levi L.M.F.T. Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist, a loving dedicated new mother, compassionate therapist specializing in mental health, areas of depression, anxiety, trauma, grief, anger management. I can help change the perspective. Committed to helping others navigate through life challenges.
Ericka Parker a Wife, Mother, Speaker, Career Coach, Recruiter, Author and Mary Kate Consultant. Founder/Shepard of PEPTALK Womens Conference. Prayer is an act of surrendering your heart and desires to God and aligning your will to his divine direction. The dictionary defines the worth pray as a verb meaning to address a solemn request or expression of thanks to a deity or other object of worship. Butterfly Principle Prayer.
Shardae Seal Jones, Founder of Dont Silence Her. Mother, motivational speaker, Student and Entrepreneur. She wears many hats all while holding down a full time job. Shardae believes in the power of telling her story and being her true authentic self. Check out her YouTube or Instagram filled with positive affirmations and videos to uplift your spirits.
Tamela Gospel a nurse, Christian Life Coach, Motivational Speaker, Self-love Coach, and Co Author The woman who serves unnoticed and un-thanked is a woman who loves God more then she desires the praise by people. Strong woman of faith two loving daughters. Tamela helps change lives in adults and children who had the patience, knowledge in wisdom deal with whatever came. Tamela is a believer of God and always receives with the help and covering the Lord Jesus Christ.
Charleszetta Baldwin, known as Charlie on the Spot to her social media supporters is quickly making her mark on the Bay Area fashion, art, and music scene. Since deciding to take a leap of faith and build her own brand nine years ago, the model, host, and fashion blogger influencer and boutique owner has been strutting down her own runway of success. Charlies natural ability to connect with the camera, as well as with key target audiences has landed her numerous gigs with major national and local brands and influencers such as: Sulmers, Angel Brinks, Diishan Imira The Black Hair King of Silicon Valley for Mayvenn Hair, pro football player and BeastMode Founder Marshawn Lynch, and Mika McCant, Owner of Spoiled Boutique, to name a few.
Tracey Frison is a Registered Respiratory Therapist, Corporate Executive Administrator, Co-Author, and Mother of three. Tracey would love to work with displaced/homeless women with children. Tracey has a passion to help women get back out into the world and workforce. She helps women by empowering, encouraging, and hosting uplifting workshops and events for women and young girls who are the most vulnerable. Tracey is looking forward to being a guest speaker/advocate and sharing her story and experiences of growing up homeless.
